datatagr: Generic Data Tagging and Validating

datatagr provides functions to tag, validate, and safeguard data of any kind. datatagr is an abstraction from linelist, which applies these principles for epidemiological data. The original proposal for this package can be found on the Discussion board.

![INFO] For our project management and roadmap, please see the relevant GitHub Project.

Installation

You can install the development version of datatagr from GitHub with:

# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("epiverse-trace/datatagr")

Example

These examples illustrate some of the current functionalities

Development

Lifecycle

This package is currently a concept, as defined by the RECON software lifecycle. This means that essential features and mechanisms are still being developed, and the package is not ready for use outside of the development team.

Contributions

Contributions are welcome via pull requests.

This project is related to other existing projects in R or other languages, but also differs from them in the following aspects:

Code of Conduct

Please note that the datatagr project is released with a Contributor Code of Conduct. By contributing to this project, you agree to abide by its terms.
